Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD made a reviewable error in rejecting the appeal based on an invalid marriage
Governing_Law: Canadian immigration law, Hindu Marriage Act, laws of India
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's claim of custom allowing cousin marriage not sufficiently supported
Evidence_Type: Legal opinion from India (not considered expert evidence), lack of expert testimony
Legal_Provision: Prohibition of marriages between first cousins under Canadian law unless overridden by custom or usage
Basis_of_Claim: Marriage to first cousin in India under claimed valid custom
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of sufficient evidence to prove existence of binding custom allowing cousin marriage
Proceeding_Type: Appeal before IAD, followed by judicial review in Federal Court
Regulation_Cited: Canadian regulations on foreign marriage validity
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to mixed questions of fact and law
Evidence_Ignored: Legal opinion not treated as expert evidence
Legal_Standard: Burden of proof on applicant to establish validity of marriage
Decision_Outcome: Permanent residence application rejected due to invalid and non-genuine marriage
Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of reviewable error in IADâ€™s assessment of marriage validity
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: A foreign marriage must be valid under the law of the place where it was celebrated and under Canadian law
Cause_of_Refusal: Invalidity of marriage and lack of genuineness
Legal_Provision_Cited: Hindu Marriage Act, Canadian immigration regulations
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide expert testimony to support claimed custom
Credibility_Issues: Insufficient proof of customary exception to cousin marriage prohibition
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that marriage was valid under Indian custom
Relevant_Law: Hindu Marriage Act, Canadian immigration law
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in judicial review of IAD decisions
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Inadmissible due to invalid marriage and lack of genuineness
